Short Sermons.--Let the message for this time be presented, not in long, labored discourses, but in short 
                                                                           168
talks, right to the point. Lengthy sermons tax the strength of the speaker and the patience of his hearers. If the speaker is one who feels the importance of his message, he will need to be especially careful lest he overtax his physical powers, and give the people more than they can remember.
